<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 386, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 431]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 431, 320, 445]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 445, 504, 460]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 489]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 255, 515]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 358, 530]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 530, 767, 559]]<|/det|>
You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. Take the weight of \(1\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 604, 585]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 757, 599]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 900, 106]]<|/det|>
In the braking system of a car, the brake pedal rotates about a pivot when the pedal is pressed. Fig. 4.1 shows part of the braking system.

(not to scale)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 332, 920, 367]]<|/det|>
The driver exerts a force of \(200\mathrm{N}\) on the pedal at a distance \(22\mathrm{cm}\) from the pivot. As the pedal rotates about the pivot, a force is exerted on the piston and the pressure of the oil increases.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 380, 670, 399]]<|/det|>
The area of the piston in the cylinder is \(5.0 \times 10^{-4} \text{m}^2\) (0.00050 \(\text{m}^2\) ).
